text: You're in an old library when you discover a book wrapped in black cloth. It calls to you. You unwrap it slowly, revealing a cover that reads, 'The Cursed City Palace of Jaipur.'
You open the book. The pages are blank. As you prepare to wrap it again, the pages flip on their own. One reads: 'You wanted to read about the empty City Palace? Let me take you there.'
A force lifts you into the air. You're sucked into the book and land with a thud at the City Palace's entrance, in front of Mubarak Mahal. It’s midnight. The full moon casts eerie shadows.
The air is heavy. You hear faint footsteps. Spirits of long-dead pehredaars begin patrolling. Their heads hang low, yet they sense your fear.
As you crouch behind the pillar, the spirits whisper in Marwari: 'Kon chhe tu?'

choices.text: Stay silent and hold your breath

text: You dash across the courtyard. The silence breaks. A trap is triggered and flying swords appear.
You hear a voice that says you made a mistake in Marwari — then you’re struck by a flying mace.
The spirits pause... then pass. You survive. The path to Rajendra Pol lies ahead.

choices.text: Inspect a strange shadow near the gallery

text: You dive and roll. A sword grazes your back but you survive. You're near Rajendra Pol now.

choices.text: Circle around to the crafts area

text: Inside Rajendra Pol, two giant silver urns gleam. You hide inside one and find a lighter. You light it. Words glow on the urn's inner wall: 'Above the moon, beyond the fire — the mantra lies on Chandra’s spire. Speak it to awaken the sleeping gods.'
A small spirit child emerges. Her eyes gleam crimson.
In the crafts demonstration area, ghostly weavers chant endlessly. One stops and looks at you.
The child's spirit tilts her head and vanishes. You feel a chill — then pain. Your skull is torn open. You scream.
You move forward and reach Pritam Chowk. The four seasonal doorways glow under the moonlight. One pulses gently.
The child smiles, then fades into ash. The path clears. You reach Pritam Chowk.
You walk through the doorway. The corridor is dark and filled with whispers. Suddenly, a swarm of ghost dogs rush at you.
You reach a narrow stairway. Paintings line the walls. Some eyes seem to move.
The painting grabs your arm. You’re pulled in. Screams echo. You vanish forever.
You stumble on loose stones and fall into a deep chamber. You can’t climb out.
You reach the art gallery. The paintings start to bleed. One animates and drives hundreds of needles into your eyes.
You finally reach the base of Chandra Mahal. A spiral staircase leads up. You hear thunder even though the sky is clear.

choices.text: Climb fast before anything stops you

text: Each step echoes like a drumbeat. You feel watched. The mantra burns in your mind.
You trip. Your head slams against the wall. Darkness takes you.
You reach the top floor. A wall bears glowing Sanskrit text — the final mantra. A storm brews above.

choices.text: Bow down and ask to be forgiven

text: You skip steps and slip. You hit your head and fall down the spiral stairwell. Your body is lost in darkness.
You chant the mantra. Light fills the room. A roar sounds from above. The ground shakes.
You bow and ask for forgiveness. Wind swirls. Time slows. You’re given a final chance.
The room glows gold. A portal opens. You leap in. You’re ejected back into the library — breathless, shaken, but alive.
The spirits are not satisfied with a whisper. You vanish in flame.
The rushed chant angers the gods. The book closes forever — with you still inside it.
